result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Lazarczyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Christopher J Lazarczyk in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.

Defendant Christopher J Lazarczyk in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin for Michael Jude.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State moved to REVOKE the DPA.  Defense OBJECTED and advised the Court of Defendant's whereabouts while on Warrant status.  COURT TOOK THE MOTION TO REVOKE UNDER ADVISEMENT AT THIS TIME.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for September 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Bail to continue as previously ordered.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 33.

Defendant Christopher J Lazarczyk in court with Attorney Randall Edward Paulson.  
Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  All parties notified, effective August 3, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
